answers.author: Israel Murguia
answers.text:
Mark,
While there may be municipalities who are using webcams for meetings, a search for a policy-like document that contains your question has not produced any results. Nevertheless, the best way to encourage telecommuting is by identifying which positions in your workplace are suitable for it. With that in mind here are some documents on best practices related to telecommuting that may assist you in that regard. Hope this helps.

answers.author: Pamela Muse
answers.text:
Mark - many local govs are using webcams for public meetings but none that I could find for internal use.  You might think about WebX or GoToMeeting either of these might prove useful and inexpensive.

answers.author: Denise Walker
answers.text:
I just ran across this today. Another option for next generation of meetings that is less cumbersome than secondlife. 
http://www.venuegen.com
We have been using WebEx integrated with our LMS very successfully since it can be launched easily from Outlook. There has been some limited utilization of video conferencing (ours is a managed service) too but that is still limited for specialized application that require actually seeing the other person. It has been slow. I also have some stats that we use to calc the savings and build the case. Let me know if you would like me to send that to you directly.

author: Mark Abeles-Allison
text: Does your municipality use webcams for meetings?  If so how do you encourage, promote use.  We are trying to encourage use of webcams in lieu of travel for short meetings.
title: Webcams for meetings?
